Gopi is right.
Sports are for the extreme rich and extreme poor.

Example - Sons of Rich guys like Kumara Mangalam Birla, Tendulkar's son, Rahul Dravid's Son etc. 

Reason is simple, rich becomes complacent and lazy. Sports means - need to work hard, take proper care of health and results are measurable. Will teach you that win/lose is not guaranteed and makes you more matured as you get to realize that success/failure is not directly proportional to efforts and so many things like team/situation/weather and other things play a role.

For the poor, anyway, nothing to lose and there is a lot of support and money in sports these days. You can show your hunger and character and make it big.

Last thing a middle class guy should do is to send their kids to sports as it is highly risky. Kids will end with super rich who don't care about money and super poor who don't have anything to lose. Lot of kids come and go in-between and if you lose out on important years (8th to 12th) you will end up as illiterate who cannot study complex stuff like mathematics, science, finance etc.

It is also dangerous for middle class kids to hang around with illiterate kids and illiterate support staff and management in our sports ecosystem.
